content.text: Write the number twenty thousand in figures

smallest

Work out
Kat has a method for finding the difference between two square numbers, \(a^2 - b^2\). Her method is
(the sum of \(a\) and \(b\)) \(\times\) (the difference between \(a\) and \(b\))
She shows her method for \(17^{2} - 13^{2}\)
Work out \(29^{2} - 21^{2}\) using Kat's method
In this part, all lengths are in centimetres
The diagram shows a prism
Work out the volume of the prism
Convert 8 litres into \(\text{cm}^3\)
Complete this statement
Show that the length of \(BC\) is \(5\mathrm{cm}\)
Complete the net of the prism on the \(1 \mathrm{~cm}^2\) grid
The base has been drawn for you
The diagram shows a triangular prism
\(ABC\) is an isosceles triangle with \(AC = BC\)
The perpendicular height of triangle \(ABC\) is \(4\mathrm{cm}\)
\(AB = 6\mathrm{cm}\) and \(BD = 6\mathrm{cm}\)
Write down the mathematical name for triangle \(BCD\)
Work out the value of \(y\)
Give two geometrical reasons for your answer
The diagram shows a triangle \(BCD\) and a straight line \(ABC\). \(DB = DC = BC\)

Jill records the temperature and the number of people on a beach for each of ten days. The results are shown in the scatter diagram

Use your graph to solve \(\frac{12}{x} = -9\)

Write down the values of \(n\) that satisfy \(7 < n \leqslant 15\)

The probability that a battery is faulty is \(\frac{1}{10}\)
